THE PRINCE ALBERT TIMES

WEDNESDAY, APRIL 18, 1883.

THE AMENDED ACT

Although not yet in possession of the full text of the Dominion Lands Act an amended and consolidated Act was enabled to pass through both Houses of Parliament that will doubtless prove interesting and valuable information to our readers and as such we shall give it prominence at present; however, we will content ourselves with merely pointing out the new sections of the Act which have been adopted, and are as follows:

The Government has now appointed officers to take charge of the Dominion Lands, who shall have power to purchase land from the Crown, or from any person who may be entitled thereto, and to convey such land to the Dominion Lands office. The officers connected with the administration of the Dominion Lands Act in the Province of North West and such duties as may be assigned them by the Governor General.

The Act provides that the Minister of the Interior may arrange to sell them on such terms as he may think fit, and that the exemption may at the same time as his lease is granted, be made subject to the provisions of the Act, and that the Minister may make such regulations as may be necessary for the purpose.

It is stated that the Marquis of Lorne, upon his return from Canada, will be placed in charge of the Department.

Letters patent have been granted to the Saskatchewan, Gold Mining and Railway Company.

The last issue of the Canada Gazette contains an application for letters patent for the Appellee Land and Colonization Company.

In the House of Commons a private bill has been introduced to incorporate the Wood Mountain and Prince Albert Railway.

It is reported to Ottawa that Mr. Foster, late Chief Secretary for Ireland, is to be the Marquis of Lorne's successor as Governor-General of Canada.

All the Magazines have included in their columns the news of the selection of Regina as the capital of Assiniboin, and nearly everybody knows that the Marquis of Lorne made such selection. If some strange coincidence the site selected was in close proximity to the town of Regina, and it was a point put up by the Lieutenant-Governor of the North West Territories, and that he has made the selection.

It is known that Mr. Foster, late Chief Secretary for Ireland, is to be the Marquis of Lorne's successor as Governor-General of Canada.

A good many temporary police are employed in the town, but they do not stop drunkenness, and that people who oppose prohibition, here as elsewhere, are looked upon with suspicion by the police.

According to a report from the Department of Agriculture, the total consumption of flour for the first two months of this year was £1,000, and for the corresponding two months of last year, £7,677.

ITEMS OF INTEREST.

The Imperial Government has refused to accept the offer of the Prince of Wales to visit Canada. The Prince of Wales has been engaged in a tour of inspection of military and naval installations throughout the Empire. His Royal Highness will be accompanied by the Duke of Connaught and the Earl of Athlone. The Prince of Wales will be visiting Canada from May 1st to May 31st.
